author: timbeiko
content:
ACDE in ~35 mins

Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/836
Stream: https://youtube.com/live/X46mbG8N5XM
Zoom: https://ethereumfoundation.zoom.us/j/91348592283?pwd=SnRnL1VTeXNYVE9CaWpBbnJEUXhQZz09

author: timbeiko
content:
**Call recap**
- **EIP-4788:** we've agreed to move forward with using a regular contract with a system write txn rather than a precompile (as suggested here: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-4788-beacon-root-in-evm/8281/35). By the testing call Monday, we'll try and (1) agree to a deployment scheme (as part of the fork or manually before), (2) agree to a first contract implementation to use and (3) have a PR to the 4788 spec reflecting this. Follow the conversation in <#753271902520213625>. Once we have a contract agreed to, we'll get an audit/formal verification process started. 
- We'll hold devnet 8's launch until we have implementations for the new 4788 spec. 
- **EIP-6780**: we'll go ahead and merge the clarifications from https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/7308
- **Engine API**: we agreed to merge https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/398 & https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/451. 
- We'll modify this PR to mention that `forkChoiceUpdateV3` is mandatory for Dencun, and then get it merged: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/426 
- **Large Validator Testnet:** the EF devops team launched a devnet with 2.1m validators, with a similar client distribution to mainnet. They ran into some finalization + block gossip issues, and will be working with client teams to diagnose/fix those in advance of the Holesky launch, which is planned to have ~1.5m validators
- Two Account Abstraction EIPs were presented and discussed: 5806 &. 7377
- <@353136597522448385> and <@1010280066028142662> gave an update on the state of Verkle: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Hgke4EHtjHBaYrIA6WbToGip6eho6INBgvwG76BIw1M/edit#slide=id.p

content: who is a good contact to ask questions about the large validator devnet? I'm doing a bit of multi-client devnet research and ran into issues I'd like to bounce off whoever orchestrated the devnet
